title: (x) Eyebright Eye Makeup Remover label script - hand lettered {Patricia}
content:
Hi, does anyone recognize this script face? A long shot, I know

But if so, thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017130341im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Eyebright_4226.gif)
author: Richard Hunt

comments.content: It looks hand lettered to me but hard to tell from the sample.
If it is not handlettered it's modified after being set. Look at the displaced "i-dot"...

Reminds me of "The Little Prince"...

--Michael.

------------------------------------------------------  
// love what you do or do something else. //  
Michael Ebert -- graphic designer, jazz saxophonist, horror movie devotee  
------------------------------------------------------

I found the web site and it looks like all the labels were hand lettered. Nice looking product line.

[http://www.farmaesthetics.com/categories.aspx](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017130341/http:/www.farmaesthetics.com/categories.aspx "http://www.farmaesthetics.com/categories.aspx")

I just received a lovely note from the founder/CEO of this company confirming that it is her handwriting on these labels and not a font. She said she receives a lot of calls asking for the name of the font. A colleague of hers tipped her off to this thread.
